contextId.information: This refers to the person speaking. AT: "who" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This refers to God. They did not want God to see them and punish them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The voice refers to the one who was speaking. John does not say who the speaker was, but it may have been God. AT: "I heard someone speaking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The voice refers to the speaker. AT "The speaker said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "voice" refers to the speaker. It is not the angel. AT: "but I heard someone speaking from heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: but I heard a voice from heaven

contextId.information: The word "voice" refers to the speaker.  AT: "The one I heard speak from heaven" or "The one who had spoken to me from heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: The voice I heard from heaven
